message: I'm excited to offer you this fantastic product! It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to start with a price of $10,000. What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, Alice, but $10,000 is a bit more than I'm comfortable with at this time. I'm willing to pay $9,000 for the product. Let's see if we can make this work.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Bob! However, I was thinking more along the lines of $10,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price for this amazing product. What do you think?
Alice, I understand you need to make a profit, but $10,500 is still a bit high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $9,500. This is my final offer, and I'm confident it's a fair price for both of us.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob! However, I was thinking more along the lines of $11,000. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make sure I'm getting a good price for this high-value product. What do you think?

Alice, I'm happy to continue negotiating, but $11,000 is still a bit out of my price range.  I'm willing to go up to $10,000, which I believe is a fair compromise considering the value of the product to both of us.  Let's close this deal and make this happen.

I appreciate your flexibility, Bob, but I'm not quite ready to meet you at $10,000 just yet. I'm willing to make a small concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. How about $10,800? It's a fair compromise, and I think it's worth considering.

Alice, I understand your need to get a good price, but I'm sticking to my limit of $10,000. This is a fair price for both of us. If you're not willing to accept that, I'll have to explore other options. Time is running out, and I don't want to miss out on this opportunity.
